(Simplified: 栀)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 巵 indicates the sound; 木 (tree) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 巵 [ zhī ] measuring cup; wine flask
①(梔子)ａ．常綠灌木或小喬木，夏季開白花，有濃香。果實卵形，可入藥，亦可作黃色染料。有的地區亦稱“水橫枝”；b．這種植物的果實。
梔子 [ zhī zi ]: cape jasmine (Gardenia jasminoides)
梔子花 [ zhī zi huā ]: cape jasmine (Gardenia jasminoides)

梔字的基本解释

梔
zhī
同“栀”。

梔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhī］
［《廣韻》章移切，平支，章。］
亦作“栀1”。
(1)木名。即栀子。
(2)染成黄色；涂饰。

梔字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　梔； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页529第01
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?章移切，音支。【說文】黄木可染。【博雅·釋木】梔子，㮁桃也。【唐本草】一名木丹，一名越桃。【圖經】生南陽川谷，今南方及西蜀州郡皆有之。木高七八尺，葉似李而堅硬，二三月生白花，夏秋結實如訶子狀，生靑熟黃，中仁深紅。　又名鮮支。【司馬相如·上林賦】鮮支黃礫。　又梔之花葉差大者，謂之林蘭。【謝靈運·山居賦】林蘭近雪而揚猗。　又作巵。【史記·貨殖傳】千畝巵茜。　又【爾雅·釋木】桑㸤有葚梔。見椹字註。

考證：〔【說文】木實可染。〕　謹照原文木實改黄木。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhī］
["Guangyun" chapter shift cut, flat branch, chapter. ]
Also known as "Zhi 1".
(1) Wooden name. Namely Gardenia.
(2) Dyeing yellow; finishing.
gardenia
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　 Zhi; Kangxi strokes: 11; Page number: page 529 01
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Chapter shift and cut, phonetic support. [Said the text] Yellow wood can be dyed. 【Bo Ya·Shimu】Gardenia, 㮁 Tao Ye. [Tang Materia Medica] One Mudan, one Yuetao. 【Picture Classics】Nanyang Chuan Valley was born, and it is found in the southern and western Shuzhou counties today. The wood is seven or eight feet high, the leaves are like plums but hard, white flowers are born in February and March, and the summer and autumn are strong like myrobalans.　Also known as Fresh Branch. [Sima Xiangru·Shanglin Fu] Fresh yellow gravel.　If the difference between the flowers and leaves of Zhizhi is large, it is called Linlan. 【Xie Lingyun·Mountain Ju Fu】Lin Lan rises near the snow.　Zuomeng again. [Historical Records · Commodity Transmission] Thousand Mu Xiqian.　[Erya·Shimu] Sang 㸤 has Bing Zhi. See note on the word 椹. Textual research: [[Said Wen] Mu Shi can be dyed. 〕　I would like to change the yellow wood according to the original wood.
